org.eodisp.remote.registry
Class LocateJeriRegistry

java.lang.Object
  org.eodisp.remote.registry.LocateJeriRegistry

public class LocateJeriRegistry
extends java.lang.Object

This is a similar class as the LocateRegistry from standard java RMI. It provides static methods to create a new JeriRegistry in the current JVM and to get proxies of registries exported in other JVMs. The returned registry is API compatible with the registry used in standard RMI. However it is not possible to get a proxy to a registry that was exported with standard RMI using this class.

A registry can be exported on different transports, but only one registry implementation is being instantiated per JVM. The createXXXRegistry methods (i.e. createTcpRegistry()>) only create a new registry if none was created before and export the registry on the given transport.

The getRegistry(URI) method can be used to receive a proxy of a remote registry. The transport to be used is encoded in the URI. See the method description for more information.

Version:
$Id:$
Author:
ibirrer

Method Detail

getRegistry

public static JeriRegistry getRegistry(java.net.URI uri,
                                       net.jini.core.constraint.MethodConstraints methodConstraints)
                                throws java.net.URISyntaxException
Returns a reference to the the remote JeriRegistry exported on the given URI. Supported transports are tcp and jxta. For tcp use an URI of the form: tcp://host:port, e.g: tcp:localhost:6789. For JXTA, the peer id of the peer that exports the registry must be specified. For example: urn:jxta:uuid-37AB0CEE1A5444728150BB2E14082E7AB251EEA11B984C4FA4DAD070711FBA4603

Distributed garbage collection is disabled on the returned proxy.

Parameters:
uri - An URI specifying the remote location of the registry.
methodConstraints - Method constraint to be set for the returned proxy. This is especially useful for JXTA proxies, to define a connection timeout other than infinite: 
 InvocationConstraints invocationConstraints = new InvocationConstraints(new ConnectionRelativeTime(1000), null);
 
 MethodConstraints methodConstraints = new BasicMethodConstraints(invocationConstraints);
Returns:
reference (a stub) to the remote object registry
Throws:
java.net.URISyntaxException - Thrown if any of the following is true:
  • The scheme of the given URI is not supported. Supported schemes are: tcp and urn:jxta
  • If no port or no host is given for a tcp URI
  • If the given peer id URI is not a valid peer id. See IDFactory.fromURI(java.net.URI)

java.net.URISyntaxException

getRegistry

public static JeriRegistry getRegistry(java.net.URI uri)
                                throws java.net.URISyntaxException
Returns a reference to the the remote JeriRegistry exported on the given URI. Supported transports are tcp and jxta. For tcp use an URI of the form: tcp://host:port, e.g: tcp:localhost:6789. For JXTA, the peer id of the peer that exports the registry must be specified. For example: urn:jxta:uuid-37AB0CEE1A5444728150BB2E14082E7AB251EEA11B984C4FA4DAD070711FBA4603

Distributed garbage collection is disabled on the returned proxy.

No MethodConstraints are being defined on the returned registry proxy. Use getRegistry(URI, MethodConstraints) to do so.

Parameters:
uri - An URI specifying the remote location of the registry.
Returns:
reference (a stub) to the remote object registry
Throws:
java.net.URISyntaxException - Thrown if any of the following is true:
  • The scheme of the given URI is not supported. Supported schemes are: tcp and urn:jxta
  • If not port or not host is given for a tcp URI
  • If the given peer id URI is not a valid peer id. See IDFactory.fromURI(java.net.URI)

createJxtaRegistry

public static JeriRegistry createJxtaRegistry()
                                       throws java.rmi.server.ExportException
Deprecated. use RemoteAppModule

Exports the JeriRegistry instance of the this JVM on peer that is defined for this JVM. See JxtaNetwork to see how the peer id is registered with a JVM.

Creating a registry does not keep the JVM alive.

Returns:
the registry
Throws:
java.rmi.server.ExportException
RemoteException - if the registry could not be exported

createTcpRegistry

public static JeriRegistry createTcpRegistry(int port)
                                      throws java.rmi.server.ExportException
Deprecated. use RemoteAppModule

Exports the JeriRegistry instance of the this JVM on the local host that accepts requests on the specified port.

Creating a registry does not keep the JVM alive.

Parameters:
port - the port on which the registry accepts requests
Returns:
the registry
Throws:
java.rmi.server.ExportException - if the registry could not be exported

public static void destroyRegistry()
